title: Music Education Curriculum Utilizing WSQ-Based Mobile Peer Assessment

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Project-based music education conducted in a smartphone-based, limited technological environment. Students develop vocal skills through peer evaluation and systematically document theoretical feedback.

learning_goals: Students analyze peers' vocal performance videos using WSQ (Watch-Summary-Question) learning sheets and provide specific feedback grounded in theoretical principles.
Learners objectively reflect on their vocal skills during peer assessment and establish improved practice plans based on this reflection.
At the experiment's conclusion, the correlation coefficient between teacher and peer assessment scores must improve to 0.7 or higher.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
